content:
Diagnosis:	Right breast cancer - Grade 1 cribriform carcinoma

Management:	15 Jan 2024 Wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy
		12 Feb 2024 Started adjuvant endocrine therapy

Histology:	pT1b (12mm) N0 (0/2) M0, Grade 1 cribriform carcinoma
	ER 8/8, PR 8/8, HER2 negative, Ki67 5%

Current Situation:	Routine follow-up on adjuvant endocrine therapy

I was pleased to review [redacted name] today for her routine follow-up appointment. She is now three months into her adjuvant endocrine therapy with anastrozole. She has adapted well to the medication and reports only mild joint stiffness in the mornings which improves with gentle exercise. Her energy levels have gradually improved since surgery, and she has returned to her usual activities including regular swimming three times per week. She has experienced some mild hot flushes but finds these manageable and is keen to continue with the current treatment.

Her breast wound has healed excellently with no concerns. She understands the importance of breast awareness and will continue with regular mammographic surveillance as planned. She has attended the local cancer support group which she has found helpful.

The plan is to continue with anastrozole 1mg daily. I have provided written information about managing side effects. We will arrange her first surveillance mammogram for January 2025 and see her back in clinic in 6 months' time. She knows to contact the breast care nurses if she has any concerns in the interim.
